answers.author: Robert Woods
answers.text:
The City of Albany, Or Dashboard has every department, program and line item published since Fiscal Year 2007-2008. 
Within the displays, Budget/Actual graphs from 2008 to present are available by line item, expense/revenue group , and program for both revenues and expenditures. Current FY information is updated daily.
http://dashboard.cityofalbany.net/Dashboard/Pages/Report.aspx?ItemPath=/Albany_Dashboard

answers.text:
Natalie, 
Thank you for your question.  I found a few resources that might be helpful to you! 
The Sunshine Review works for transparency in local and state governments.  They posted about the Ohio state budget and its facets.  
http://sunshinereview.org/index.php/Ohio_state_budget
Texas Transparency displays the most open, financial websites.
http://www.texastransparency.org/local/spotlight.php 
ICMA posted a great Publication on their Bookstore by Justin Marlowe, “Budget as a Communication Tool.”  Download it here.
http://bookstore.icma.org/Budget_as_a_Communication_Tool_P1619.cfm?UserID=1635075
Hope these resources help!
Hilary Badger
Knowledge Network, Intern
ICMA

author: Natalie Wyman
text: Do other localities prepare and publish historical budget v. actual information online? Our budget historical information is basically a data dump, and we would like to make it more reader-friendly, so we are interested in examples of how other localities are presenting their budget historical documents on their website.
title: Publishing Historical Budget Information Online
